column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Diy_coref|
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Diy_coref_re|BT_webanno.custom.Diy_coref
#Text=[0101] Thus the total fraction of light that can escape from the semiconductor can be calculated by dividing the previous expression by 4.pi.: .OMEGA./4.pi.=1/2(1-cos.theta.)
#Text=According to this expression, only 4% of the incident radiation is extracted in a GaN based LED.

#Text=Thus, in LEDs, most of the internally reflected radiation is re-absorbed, since in an LED that operates below lasing threshold, the per-pass stimulated gain is less than per-pass absorption losses.

#Text=[0102] The formation of III-nitride templates and epitaxial growth of nitride devices on such templates can be developed, for example, using three different epitaxial methods, which are described below.
#Text=[0103] The HVPE method is used for the development of GaN or AlN quasi-substrates (templates).
#Text=This deposition method employs HCl to transport the Ga to the substrate in the form of GaCl.
#Text=Growth of GaN in the presence of HCl has also a number of additional advantages.
#Text=HCl etches excess Ga from the surface of the growing film, and this enables high growth rates (100-200.about..mu.
#Text=/hr).
#Text=It also etches defective GaN occurring primarily at the boundaries of the hexagonal domains due to incomplete coalescence of such domains.
#Text=Finally, another advantage is the leaching of metallic impurities, which tend to contribute recombination centers in most semiconductors.
#Text=Thus this method leads to very high quality GaN films.
#Text=[0104] A textured GaN template according to the invention is grown by a modified HVPE process.
#Text=The GaN template can be grown via a modified HVPE reactor.
#Text=In the reactor, the group III precursor can be GaCl gas, which is synthesized upstream by flowing HCl on a quartz-boat containing Ga at temperatures from about 500.degree.
#Text=C. to 1000.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=GaCl gas then mixes with ammonia (NH.sub.3) downstream near the surface of the substrate wafer to form GaN at temperatures between about 900.degree.
#Text=C. to 1200.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=A GaN or AlN or AlGaN template of the invention can be grown along polar and non-polar directions.
#Text=The templates can also grow in their cubic structure by choosing a substrate having cubic symmetry such as for example (100)Si (001)GaAs.
#Text=In this case the subsequent nitride layers grown on it will have cubic symmetry as well.
#Text=[0105] The modified reactor is generally divided into four zones in which each zone temperature can be individually controlled.
#Text=The reactor also has three separate delivery tubes for the reactant gases and diluents.
#Text=Nitrogen or hydrogen is used as a diluent and carrier gases to NH.sub.3 and HCl.
#Text=Nitrogen is sent through the middle tube where it acts as a downstream gas sheath to prevent the premixing of the GaCl and NH.sub.3 before the gases contact the substrate surface.
#Text=The texturing of the GaN layer can be attributed to the etching effects of HCl.
#Text=For example, texturing occurs as HCl etches Ga from the surface of the growing layer.
#Text=HCl also etches defective GaN at the boundary domains of the first layer.
#Text=The HCl concentration of the modified HVPE process is substantially higher than that of typical deposition processes where texturing is avoided.
